%s

With more than 50 years of experience Airports and Auxiliary Services (ASA) operates, manages, builds and maintains airports; provides fuel supply services, offers technical assistance and consulting, as well as instruction and research in aeronautical and airport matters.
Error trying to download the file

Our airport management and operations service focuses on achieving operational excellence, optimizing every detail to offer an efficient and comfortable experience. We transform your terminal into a benchmark of quality, raising standards and creating memorable moments for passengers and airlines.

According to Mandatory Circular CO DA 002/2010 R2, aerodrome certification consists of five phases. Of these, the ASA Verification Unit (UV ASA) participates in three: documentary inspection, on-site inspection, and on-site re-inspection.

The ASA Verification Unit (ASA UV) promptly and effectively addresses the inspection requirements established by ICAO and national aviation authorities, with the aim of supporting aerodromes in obtaining their certification.

The International Airport Training and Support Services Center (CIIASA) was inaugurated in June 2010 with the goal of becoming a global benchmark in aeronautical training. Recognized by ICAO as a TRAINAIR PLUS Center of Excellence and in Civil Aviation Security, CIIASA offers specialized and up-to-date training to strengthen airport security in Mexico and Latin America.

With ASA, you have a reliable partner in the aviation fuel industry in Mexico, with a presence in 61 fuel plants and two points of sale throughout the countrys airport network. Its strategic storage infrastructure enables it to offer quality service nationwide.

We have highly trained personnel who comply with ICAO and international standards. We offer specialized training through courses developed in collaboration with the ASA International Training Center. We have extensive experience in complex operations and utilize modern systems to control our customers supplies.
